questions.text: Original: 'Had the committee not intervened promptly, the entire project would have collapsed irreversibly.'
options: Without the committee's prompt intervention, the project would have suffered irreversible collapse.
The committee's intervention prevented the project from collapsing, but it was too late.
Despite the committee's intervention, the project collapsed completely.
The committee intervened after the project had already collapsed irreversibly.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה התנאי השלישי עם היפוך (inversion) - 'Had the committee not...' במקום 'If the committee had not...'. המשפט מבטא מצב היפותטי בעבר שבו התערבות הוועדה מנעה קריסה. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את המשמעות המדויקת: ללא התערבות מהירה, הפרויקט היה קורס באופן בלתי הפיך. שאר האפשרויות משנות את המשמעות - מציגות כישלון של ההתערבות או קריסה שכבר התרחשה.
examples: Had she studied harder, she would have passed the exam → Without harder studying, she would have failed the exam.
Had we left earlier, we wouldn't have missed the flight → If we hadn't left earlier, we would have missed the flight.
questions.grammarRule: Third conditional with inversion: 'Had + subject + past participle' = 'If + subject + had + past participle'. Used for hypothetical past situations.
questions.commonMistakes: Confusing the cause-effect relationship, misunderstanding the hypothetical nature, or changing the timeline of events.
questions.usageTip: When you see inverted conditionals (Had/Were/Should at the beginning), identify the implied 'if' clause and the consequence to maintain exact meaning.

questions.text: Original: 'Scarcely had the CEO announced the merger when shareholders began expressing their vehement opposition.'
options: The CEO had barely announced the merger before shareholders started voicing strong opposition.
After the CEO announced the merger, shareholders gradually began to oppose it.
The shareholders opposed the merger before the CEO could announce it properly.
Despite the CEO's announcement, shareholders remained silent about their opposition.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה 'Scarcely had... when...' שמבטא רצף מהיר של אירועים - כמעט מיד אחרי ההכרזה החלו בעלי המניות להתנגד. זהו מבנה ספרותי עם היפוך הדורש שימוש ב-'had' לפני הנושא. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את הרצף המהיר ('barely... before') ואת עוצמת ההתנגדות ('vehement' = 'strong'). האפשרויות האחרות משנות את הזמן (הדרגתי במקום מיידי), הסדר (התנגדות לפני הכרזה), או מציגות שתיקה במקום התנגדות.
examples: Scarcely had we arrived when it started raining → We had barely arrived before it started raining.
Hardly had she finished speaking when applause erupted → She had barely finished speaking before applause erupted.
questions.grammarRule: Scarcely/Hardly/Barely + had + subject + past participle + when/before clause. Expresses immediate sequence of events with inversion.
questions.commonMistakes: Missing the immediacy of the sequence, changing the intensity of actions, or misunderstanding the inverted structure.
questions.usageTip: Scarcely/Hardly = Barely. These structures emphasize how quickly the second action followed the first.

questions.text: Original: 'Not until the investigation was complete did the authorities realize the full extent of the corruption.'
options: The authorities didn't realize the full extent of the corruption until the investigation was complete.
Before the investigation was complete, the authorities already knew about the corruption.
The authorities realized some corruption during the investigation, but not all of it.
Only after completing the investigation did the corruption become apparent to everyone.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה 'Not until...' עם היפוך, שמדגיש שהרשויות הבינו את מלוא היקף השחיתות רק לאחר השלמת החקירה, ולא לפני כן. ההיפוך דורש שימוש ב-'did' אחרי 'Not until + clause'. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את המשמעות המדויקת ללא היפוך: הרשויות לא הבינו עד שהחקירה הושלמה. האפשרויות האחרות משנות את המשמעות - מציגות ידיעה מוקדמת, הבנה חלקית, או מרחיבות את ההבנה לכולם ולא רק לרשויות.
examples: Not until midnight did she return home → She didn't return home until midnight.
Not until he apologized did she forgive him → She didn't forgive him until he apologized.
questions.grammarRule: 'Not until + time/condition + auxiliary verb + subject + main verb' = 'Subject + didn't + verb + until + time/condition'
questions.commonMistakes: Forgetting the negative aspect, changing who gained the realization, or altering the timing of the realization.
questions.usageTip: When you see 'Not until' at the beginning with inversion, convert it to 'didn't...until' to maintain the same meaning.
